3. Arrange gummy worms throughout to represent tentacles.

noteCook.name: D√úNGEONMEISTER TIP
entries: The kraken itself has been depicted in many different forms‚Äîsometimes as a giant squid or other tentacled beast, and sometimes as a giant claymation creature from the black lagoon with four arms. Such is the mystery and majesty of the mighty beast.

recipe.name: D√ºngeonmeister

entries: When it comes time to proffer a drink to the one running your game, it‚Äôs best to err on the side of something delicious that anyone could enjoy. This mix of liqueurs simulates a fresh cookie, in case you didn‚Äôt have any homemade to give as an offering.

instructions: 1. Combine all ingredients in an ice-filled shaker and shake well.
2. Strain into a shot glass.

noteCook.name: D√úNGEONMEISTER TIP
entries: Oftentimes people will talk about pizza in relation to their GM‚Äîbuying pizza, not touching the GM‚Äôs pizza‚Äîall in an attempt to bribe them. I find that the better way to butter up the game master is to get them sloshed and ask for that magic item you‚Äôve been wanting.

recipe.name: Horror Factor

entries: When determining just how spooky a monster is, there is a very scientific formula known as the horror factor that one can use. It takes into account all the many aspects of a thing. For example, while this drink might seem spooky at first, it is actually fairly low on the horror factor due to its blend of creamy and tangy flavors. Also, because it is a drink.

instructions: 1. Combine rum, heavy cream, syrup, and egg white in a shaker (no ice) and shake vigorously for at least 30 seconds to combine.
2. Add ice to the shaker and shake again to chill.
3. Strain into a coupe glass, and slowly fill with apple cider.
4. Top with powdered activated charcoal.

noteCook.name: D√úNGEONMEISTER TIP
entries: If you can‚Äôt find powdered activated charcoal, do not substitute for nonactivated charcoal. We cannot stress this enough. However, the ashes ofa burned ghost should suffice. Don‚Äôt use any other kind of ashes, though. You‚Äôll get so haunted.

recipe.name: Fudge the Dice

entries: When you‚Äôre on the brink of disaster and that crucial roll just won‚Äôt happen, sometimes you need to fudge the roll a little. When you feel like you deserve a win, you can‚Äôt go wrong with this chocolaty, decadent drink that‚Äôs so good it feels like you‚Äôre cheating.

instructions: 1. Combine all ingredients except whipped cream and cherry in a blender and blend until smooth.
2. Pour into a stemmed glass such as a hurricane glass.
3. Top with whipped cream and cherry

noteCook.name: D√úNGEONMEISTER TIP
entries: The jury is out on whether fudging the dice is an acceptable practice. Some think it‚Äôs never okay. Some say it‚Äôs okay only for GMs to do it in order to save the party from random chance ruining things. Still others say that ifyour dice are made of fudge, then they aren‚Äôt going to keep very well and you should eat them immediately.

recipe.name: The Level Up

entries: Players are going to feel like celebrating when they level up; it‚Äôs just the nature of the game! When it happens, why not boost those festivities with a drink that‚Äôs sunny, bright, and effervescent to boot? Give them a little taste of the good life, then start throwing monsters and traps at them again.

ingredients: 2 tablespoons simple syrup (see recipe in Tavern Basics) or honey
instructions: 1. Pour enough simple syrup or honey into a small bowl to cover the bottom.
2. Dip a champagne flute in simple syrup, then roll in coconut, and set aside to set (about 1 minute).
3. Add pineapple and coconut juices to flute, then fill with champagne or sparkling wine and serve immediately.

noteCook.name: D√úNGEONMEISTER TIP
entries: If you‚Äôre still playing an old-school game at your table, one old enough to have level drain, you‚Äôd be well advised to avoid this drink, or at least provide a bucket.

recipe.name: The Natural 20

entries: Few moments are more worthy of celebration than the one when your die clatters to a halt on that magic number, 20. It‚Äôs a crit! And if a critical hit is something you‚Äôre after, you‚Äôd do well to try this celebratory drink the next time you need to dig out the hit location chart to see what you‚Äôve heroically separated from the bugbear. Savor the 5 percent chance of ultimate victory, which naturally is a blend of fruit and berry given complex life by the addition of a touch of the bittersweet. After all, your celebration song is some unfortunate monster‚Äôs dirge.

ingredients: ¬Ω ounce simple syrup (see recipe in Tavern Basics)
instructions: 1. Combine all ingredients except blackberries in a shaker with ice and shake vigorously.
2. Strain into a chilled martini glass.
3. Spear both blackberries on a toothpick and hang them over the rim.

recipe.name: Never Split the Party Punch

entries: Veteran players know that when you are faced with a problem, you should never split the party and instead face everything as a unified team. This bubbly, sweet drink will make sure that everyone wants to gather together and no rogues go off by themselves.

ingredients: 3 ounces soda water or sparkling wine
instructions: 1. Fill a punch bowl about halfway with ice.
2. Add all ingredients to bowl and mix well.
3. Serve in punch cups over ice.
4. Garnish each drink with 2 sliced strawberries.

noteCook.name: D√úNGEONMEISTER TIP
entries: The secret to a good party punch is to keep an extra amount of all the ingredients separately, not only so that you can make more punch but so that individuals can add more of anything to their own drink to make it more to their liking. Now everybody in the party is happy. Except Dan. That guy‚Äôs never happy. C‚Äômon, Dan!

recipe.name: Session Zero

entries: Before really getting into the adventure, lots of groups have a Session Zero in order to establish things that they want out of the game. This refreshing and easy-to-make punch gets everybody around the table and talking to each other, the perfect start to the night.

ingredients: 1 lemon, sliced into wheels, for garnish
instructions: 1. Combine all ingredients except lemon in a punch bowl.
2. Mix with a spoon and chill until serving.
3. Garnish punch cups with 1 lemon wheel each.

noteCook.name: D√úNGEONMEISTER TIP
entries: Sometimes people will skip the Session Zero and get right into the thick of it. While certainly a valid way of doing things, there is something to be said for making sure that you don‚Äôt show up to the group with an Orc Barbarian and your friend is a Paladin of Hating Specifically Orcs.

recipe.name: The TPK

entries: TPK stands for Total Party Kill, which is the moment at which an encounter is too overwhelming and demolishes every character without a chance. It is brutal, it is sudden, and it will be regretted in the morning, thus the TPK. You‚Äôll need something this strong to wash defeat out of your mouth.

instructions: 1. Combine all ingredients except soda and cherry in a chilled highball glass with ice.
2. Fill with soda.
3. Garnish with cherry and serve.

noteCook.name: D√úNGEONMEISTER TIP
entries: When facing down the sad and inevitable doom of a TPK, try to remain calm. Make yourself comfortable as the crushing enormity of your failure crashes down around you. Just remember: It‚Äôs all the GM‚Äôs fault. If theydidn‚Äôt want you to attack that dragon, they shouldn‚Äôt have given it so much treasure.

recipe.name: Treasure Type J

entries: The hard-earned reward for slaying a particularly challenging dragon, the Treasure Type J is a hoard indeed, gold shot through with yet more gold. A spicy-sweet taste of the glories that keep your party venturing into mortal danger, this cocktail is an exceptional celebration for an adventure well played.

instructions: 1. Pour Goldschl√§ger and lemon juice into a champagne or martini glass.
2. Add sparkling wine and bitters.
3. Stir gently to combine.

noteCook.name: D√úNGEONMEISTER TIP
entries: The actual Treasure Type J is mostly the garbage left behind when a giant spider eats a bunch of farmers, and their scattered tools and copper pieces rain to the sodden cave floor below. Creative license has been applied here, as Treasure Type H, the huge mountains of gold on which dragons slumber, has a worse ring to it. No one wants to drink an H.

recipe.name: Astral Diamond Juice

entries: The astral diamond is the ultimate currency. Worth thousands of gold, unheard of by the common folk, and draped in beauty hitherto unspoken, these gems are the coin of the realm for the most powerful wizards, the most opulent demigods, and the most mythical merchants. In this recipe, we teach you how to squeeze one and drink what comes out of there.

instructions: 1. Combine gin, cr√®me de violette, and blue cura√ßao in a mixing glass with ice.
2. Squeeze lemon wedge into same glass and discard the peel.
3. Stir, and strain into a champagne flute.
4. Fill with champagne or sparkling wine and sprinkle the top with silver luster dust.

noteCook.name: D√úNGEONMEISTER TIP
entries: Though for most mortals the astral diamond is little more than a myth, that‚Äôs no excuse not to flaunt one if you have it. Once you‚Äôve crafted this cocktail, be conspicuous about it. And don‚Äôt share it with anyone without an exchange of at least a Sun Blade or Vorpal sword.

recipe.name: Electrum Piece

entries: The rarely seen electrum piece is minted from an alloy of gold and silver, and is worth five silver pieces. Despite being half the value of a gold piece, they have a reputation in many fantasy circles akin to the two-dollar bill in that they‚Äôre worth two dollars unless you‚Äôre someone‚Äôs weird uncle, at which point they become priceless. As a shot, they combine gold and silver in an alloy of explosive flavor that will entertain much more than any aforementioned weird uncle.

instructions: 1. Pour Goldschl√§ger and energy drink into a shot glass.
2. Add pearl luster dust and swirl with a swizzle stick.

noteCook.name: D√úNGEONMEISTER TIP
entries: Dragons are known to hoard the electrum piece from time to time when forming their mighty piles to defend. This could be for a variety of reasons, from availability of gold to magical preference. Most commonly, however, it is held up as evidence that even dragons can be weird uncles.

recipe.name: Magic Mirror

entries: Magic mirrors are versatile artifacts that can let you see other places or future events, or even discern a metric of standard beauty by which one could judge someone against another. Whatever you see in this glimmering cocktail, you can be sure that the sweet flavor and unique look will make this the fairest in the land.

instructions: 1. Combine rum, blue cura√ßao, and grenadine in an ice-filled shaker and shake to combine.
2. Strain into two cocktail glasses.
3. Add ¬Ω teaspoon luster dust to each glass and stir to dissolve.
4. Garnish each glass with a lemon twist.

noteCook.name: D√úNGEONMEISTER TIP
entries: For most people, a magic mirror is one of the most important assets you could have. You can gain intel on enemy movements, spy on rival kingdoms, and see into a possible future for your endeavors. Judging a beauty contest is probably the least useful thing you could do with one.

recipe.name: Potion of Glibness

entries: Some people just don‚Äôt have the gift of gab. Others merely want to improve their already decent social talents. Whatever the reason, many an adventurer has turned to a Potion of Glibness. With a sour and smooth flavor, this particular potion is sure to loosen up your lips and get the words flowing.

instructions: 1. Combine all ingredients in an ice-filled shaker and shake vigorously.
2. Strain into a cocktail glass.

noteCook.name: D√úNGEONMEISTER TIP
entries: Nothing is worse than when you‚Äôre chatting up everyone and being the life of the party and suddenly your Potion of Glibness wears off. What to do? This simple incantation can get you out of there without anyone the wiser. Verbal Component: ‚ÄúWow, look at the time!‚Äù Somatic Component: Going home.

No one is sure when we started to accept as a society that blue is exceptional but purple is epic, but at this point in our collective experience this is an indisputable fact. If you‚Äôre looking for the right libation to tout an upgrade from the above average to the extraordinary, this cocktail, which near-miraculously shifts from blue to purple before being consumed, is the way to do it. The secret lies in rapid pH alteration of the pea flower tea, so keep your flask of citric acid water handy to shift this beverage from a gin and tea to a gin and lemon in an instant.

ingredients.name: For the Butterfly Pea Flower Tea:
entries: 3 grams dried butterfly pea flowers
1 cup hot water

ingredients.name: For the Cocktail:
entries: ¬Ω teaspoon citric acid
6 tablespoons water
2 ounces gin
¬æ ounce simple syrup (see recipe in Tavern Basics)
1 ounce Butterfly Pea Flower Tea

instructions.name: For the Butterfly Pea Flower Tea:
entries: Make the tea by adding pea flowers to hot water, steeping at least 5‚Äì7 minutes until very dark blue.

instructions.name: For the Cocktail:
entries: Combine citric acid and water and stir to combine, then add to a small vial or shot glass.3. Combine gin, simple syrup, and tea in an ice-filled shaker and shake to combine.
Strain into a martini glass.
When ready to serve, add citric acid mixture to drink and watch it change color.

recipe.name: Pool of Radiance

entries: Planning a spooky party or an extended dungeon run? This playful punch can add a touch of magic and mysticism to your snack table. You‚Äôll need a black light on hand, and when it‚Äôs switched on you‚Äôll be presented with a glowing beverage, shot through with yet more radiant ice cubes gleaming like mystic jewels in the depths. The secret is the fluorescing quinine in tonic water, which lends the drink its distinctive bitterness. We battle that bitterness with pineapple, lime, and orange flavors, resulting in a magical phial of glowing goodness.

ingredients.name: For the Ice:
entries: 3 cups flat tonic water

ingredients.name: For the Cocktail:
entries: 24 ounces pisco
12 ounces Cointreau
12 ounces lime juice
12 ounces pineapple juice
7 cups tonic water

instructions: 1. For the Ice: Fill ice cube trays with tonic water and put in the freezer 24 hours in advance.
2. For the Cocktail: Combine pisco, Cointreau, lime juice, and pineapple juice in a large container and stir to combine. Refrigerate until ready to serve.
3. Add juice mixture to a punch bowl and add tonic water, stirring gently to combine.
4. Add ice cubes and serve in punch glasses under your preferred black light.

recipe.name: Potion of Strength

entries: While a practiced hand and a trained body cannot be replaced with a mere potion, those wishing to give themselves the alchemical edge over their opponent will turn to potions. This bubbling dark elixir appears murky at first but hides a powerful sweetness within.

instructions: 1. Combine juice, vodka, and black raspberry liqueur in a shaker with ice and shake to combine.
2. Strain into two chilled martini glasses.
noteCook: If you‚Äôre going into battle and you need to be at your strongest, this is the potion for you. You may even find that the potion is too strong for you, and you will have to travel to a potion seller who sells weaker potions. If such is the case, make sure that they have respect for knights such as yourself
